comments.body: Should be, since we start ingesting log entries as soon as they start flowing. From the manual runs that's more than enough, but I don't know of any guarantees/SLOs here (docs say log entries should appear ["right away"](https://cloud.google.com/logging/docs/export/using_exported_logs#availability_2). I suggest leaving this as it is and then applying a fix if that's not enough, though I think timing out would indicate a problem with fluentd not being performant enough, rather than test being too restrictive on time.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +49,53 @@		linesPerSecond := 1000 * nodeCount
		linesPerPod := linesPerSecond * int(loggingDuration.Seconds()) / podCount
		ingestionTimeout := 20 * time.Minute

		By("Running logs generator pods")
